item.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18709)
item.content:encoded:

Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=blm5280&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

item.title: “A rally for the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“A rally for the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American Community and our allies to mourn those lost to Anti-Asian hate, celebrate our strength and diversity, and band together to move forward in doing anti-racist work.

Join us for music, poetry, words of wisdom, healing, and more.

Make sure to bring water, snacks, and layers in case it gets cold!

...

Want to VOLUNTEER? Sign up here: https://forms.gle/koQPMGHDnpaRpPuP6”

See More

SAT, MAR 27 AT 11:00 AM MDT

Stop AAPI Hate Colorado Community Rally

Colorado State Capitol

· DenverCauses · 539 people
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Join Black Parents of Denver, Get Busy Living Studios,...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Join Black Parents of Denver, Get Busy Living Studios, TAndIVoice, Taylors Voice & Compound of compassion as we bring awareness to the ongoing violence within Denver's communities and the Police brutality that comes along with our struggle. We Will have What's Happening Catering On site to feed our houseless friends in Denver. Our goal is to feed 300 people on this day hot fresh food. You can purchase a ticket from anywhere in the world to feed a person, 15 dollars gets them ...a full plate and a drink. You can also watch our live performances from Artists Like Texas Rapper C-Lane and Denver's own Nic Wit It, Trrii the Truth and Chane Clouds, along with many poets, speakers and special guest Jessie Cedillos mother, Lynette Fox speaking. Vendors Are welcome to come set up pls call 7202699902 all fees collected for vendor booth will go to feeding our houseless friends. Participants are encouraged to bring outreach resources to event such as clothes, canned goods or toiletries to pass out to our houseless friends. If any community organization would like to come out and participate pls call 7202699902

See More

SAT, MAR 27 AT 10:00 AM MDT

Stop The Violence Denver 2021 Buy a homeless person a plate!!!

Online EventCauses · 206 people

item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

🙌🏿🙌🏿🙌🏿

FrontLine Farming

Here to drop some good news. ✨

The Agricultural Bill of Rights (#sb21087) made it out of the Senate Committee last night!

Just as Karen McCormick said during th...e pre-hearing press conference yesterday, IT'S TIME.

Let's keep working.

#AgWorkersRights #SB21087 #FarmWorkerJustice #FoodJusticeIsRacialJustice

item.title: This is a free event, y’all! Registration now open! As we are...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

This is a free event, y’all! Registration now open!

As we are all facing ongoing adversity, we are learning to navigate our struggles in innovative ways. Join our conversation with Common, Grammy and Academy Award winning artist and activist, and Dr. Apryl Alexander, prominent psychologist, as they discuss the many paths we can create to cope and come together with our communities to begin healing.
https://rsvp.du.edu/…/7b410520-f1fa-43ef-8cb2-353ce…/summary

item.title: *We are not the organizers of this event; it is community-led* ...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

*We are not the organizers of this event; it is community-led*
#StopAsianHate #StopAAPIHate #AAPI #EndWhiteSupremacy #Solidarity

Img text: Candlelight Vigil & Night of Remembrance
to honor the lives taken and affected by anti-Asian violence

...

The vigil will be held at the site of Denver’s Chinatown, that flourished until 1880, when it was destroyed violently by a racist mob. One man was killed and Chinatown never fully recovered. Chinatown was used as a scapegoat for many of Denver’s issues; the name “Hop Alley” was derived from false accusations of opium overuse, far more common among white residents of Denver. Solidarity with all Asian relatives near and abroad! End white supremacy in all its forms!
Saturday, March 20th, 6pm
southeast corner of 20th and Blake St.

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: ***ACTION ALERT*** In solidarity with FrontLine Farming, we need...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

***ACTION ALERT***

In solidarity with FrontLine Farming, we need your help ensuring that Colorado agricultural workers get the basic rights already afforded other workers in the state through this bill: Concerning Agricultural Workers Rights SB21-087.

For almost a century, agricultural workers have been excluded from many of this country’s most important and hard-fought labor protections, including the right to organize, the right to overtime pay, and in the case of thousands... of Colorado farmworkers, the right to minimum wage. The origins of these exclusions, which go back decades, are explicitly racist--originally part of an effort to exclude Black workers from the New Deal’s most important labor protections. Especially now, after a year in which farmworkers have suffered disproportionately from the pandemic and toiled in wildfires and extreme heat to bring food to our tables, it is essential that we close these anachronistic gaps and provide basic protections and dignity to some of the State’s most vulnerable workers.

Use this form to contact Colorado Senators TODAY BEFORE the 1pm MST committee hearing: https://www.projectprotectfoodsystems.org/sb-21-087

See MoreWe need your help ensuring that Colorado agricultural workers get the basic rights already afforded other workers in the state through this bill: Concerning Agricultural Workers Rights SB21-087.

projectprotectfoodsystems.org

SB 21- 087 | PROJECT PROTECT

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
